H0.text: Producers are organisms that make energy available to all other organisms in a food chain.

H1.text: Decomposers make energy available to all other organisms in a food chain.

H2.text: Consumers are organisms that make energy available to all other organisms in a food chain.

H3.text: Scavengers are the organisms that make energy available to all other organisms in a food chain.

A4.text: Plants, along with other primary producers, produce the energy that other living beings consume, and the oxygen that they breathe.

A5.text: Without primary producers, organisms that are capable of producing energy on their own, the biological systems of Earth would be unable to sustain themselves.
